do up.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to fasten something, or to be fastened in a particular way
do up.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: a skirt which does up at the back
Do up your coat or you’ll get cold.
do up.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to repair an old building or car, or to improve its appearance
do up.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: They did up an old cottage in the Scottish Highlands.
do up.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to decorate something in a particular way
do up.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: The apartment was done up in Viennese style.
do up.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: to make yourself look neat and attractive
do up.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: Sue spent ages doing herself up.
